of7f4y45MA3koaKUM_YnUg.text: I recently had dinner there last week ... The food is so good , the Italian wedding soup was delicious the atmosphere was perfect .. When I'm in town again I definitely would go back , my family introduced the restaurant to me and they eat there all the time !!!

iitsCojuLGI_eGvk1dfjHA.text: After reading some reviews on here and also having been to the restaurant that previously occupied the space, I was a little hesitant to eat here tonight. However, I was pleasantly surprised.   The decor was much nicer than I expected. The restaurant was clean and decorated nicely.  We were greeted promptly by our waitress. She was very friendly and great with our 17 month old son.   Our orders were taken promptly and bread was brought to the table quickly. The dipping oil was delicious! I had the house salad with the fig balsamic vinegarette. It was incredibly good. My husband had a cup of the sausage bean soup which he thought was pretty good. For our entrees, I had the pesto gnocchi and my husband had the lamb ragu.  The pesto gnocchi was outstanding! I was served with a pesto cream sauce and candied walnuts. The walnuts made me hesitate at first, but I am so glad that I took a chance and tried it. It was a fabulous combination. I ended up bringing about 1/3 of mine home for later. My husband liked the lamb ragu, but didn't love it. I tasted it and it was good, but nothing to rave about. My son got the children's pizza. It was HUGE. He will get a few more meals out of the pizza for sure. When we were finished, the waitress took care of the check promptly.   Overall, I had an excellent meal. My food was delicious, the service was spot on, and the restaurant was clean and pretty. Another plus, they are in the Enjoyment book! I recommend giving them a chance. I think you will be pleasantly surprised!!

PWfqkn6e5881vy7yJRKl-g.text: My wife and I went to Gianna Via's on 1/13/13 for a date night.  We were seated with no wait and drinks/menus were brought promptly.  We ordered the garlic bread pizza for an appetizer and I was pleasantly surprised at how big the portion was.  We actually only ate half and took the rest home.  I ordered the prime rib salad and my wife ordered the chicken marsala.  I also ordered a large yeungling draft, but the waitress was nice enough to point out that they were running a special on another size, which saved us some money on the bill.    The food came and we were not disappointed.  The salad was large and had quality greens, no iceberg lettuce.  The meat was also good, as were the dressing and other toppings.  My wife's marsala was not a huge portion, but it tasted great and was very filling.  The experience was great until it came time for the bill.  We had been finished eating for approximately 30 minutes and our waitress had not returned.  She had been given a large table and was preoccupied with taking care of them.  After another 15 minutes, I went to the bar to ask for takeout boxes and went to the hostess table to get our bill.  They had to track down our waitress so that we could pay (I think the owner had to track her down).  We were able to then pay, but nobody really apologized for the wait or offered anything in return.  Overall the restaurant is a great value and a nice atmosphere with great quality food.  I was just disappointed in how long it took to get our bill and pay.  We will definitely return again.

M_8VRxAwWjWzfrDarbsA1g.text: Just had my birthday dinner celebration there the other night- dinner special was the prime rib. It was excellent! Now the downside- we had a party of 15- a task that is no small feat for 1 server, even in optimally staffed situations. Our server was on top of things at first but it soon became clear that the supporting staff was spread EXTREMELY thin. I understand that this fault does not fall to the server, rather it is a very poor reflection on management. 1 server for multiple tables of 10+ guests at each table is a management FAIL. 70 min+ until everyone at the table had their dinner. I really felt bad for the staff. They did do their level best, and as such, I tipped accordingly to their True effort.  Disorganized chaos is a polite way to put it. Sorry guys, I'll be going elsewhere in the future for these types of occasions. But hey! My prime rib was excellent!

wrbHpXRzCZR4b64p9i5LeA.text: Owner is an absolute terror. Yelling at servers across the dining area and raucously partying with friends/family while my family is trying to enjoy a meal. I was shocked when I complained and the server told me the seemingly intoxicated bafoon was the owner. Food was mediocre at best (think below Olive Garden and way below Pasta too) and atmosphere stinks.

05jZ1jITQRlixuA0_Q0zHg.text: I am writing to express my disappointment during our recent dining experience, at Gianna Via's.  From the time this restaurant opened, my husband and I have been loyal weekly customers.  We talked very highly of this restaurant and recommended it to many people.  It is in a convenient location from our home and the food here had been great.  There is a wide selection of food to choose from, the staff were able and willing to make recommendations, and were very attentive to all of our needs.    During our most recent trip, we sat in the bar area.  We ordered drinks as we looked over the menu, were happy with our experience thus far.  Soon after, the owner of the restaurant came in and sat near us.  All of the staff seemed to get very tense when he walked in.  From the time he sat down, he criticized the staff, drinks, and the food in front of us and the rest of the customers.  He even brought the chef out to reprimand him for his cooking, making us feel very uncomfortable.  I feel as if this was very unprofessional.  Many individuals from South Hills Country club were there for their dinner as well.  The owner talked to them only making us feel almost unwanted in this establishment.  We left there that night, feeling bad that we actually have been giving this guy our money.    I feel as if it is one thing to hold a daily meeting to voice concerns, helping the staff and restaurant improve as a whole, but to do it in front of customers is completely uncalled for.  Again, I do not find this professional at all.  After recently reading reviews, I find this is a common complaint of customers and sometimes it goes so far that the owner talks about the people who confront him on his wrongdoing.  I may only have one mouth, but it is a big mouth, as a dissatisfied customer I will make sure never to return and to tell others of our horrible experience at this place, so that they do not make the same mistake of being a patron here again.

15u7o2PB69Yf0j7Cdt6rig.text: This place is right by my office and I can always go for their wedding soup. I'm not sure how to explain their wedding soup other than it's just amazing. It comes in an actual cup with a handle, which I love, there are always tons of noodles as well. The food that I've had has been great but I have not heard great things about the pizza though I've never had it from there. The turkey flatbread is awesome as well as the tuna but I always say light in the mayo for the tuna.

cqBIz6Gy53AJQfbs5QTOTw.text: I stopped in for breakfast with a friend one morning. Good prices and portions. Service was decent. Not super attentive, but didn't ignore us either. I just had eggs, bacon, toast and coffee. It was all good, and I would go back again.

ky7LvRZZPq1JyCbDQbpI0w.text: A bit Overpriced.  At these prices the food quality should be better. The food isn't bad   but not great either, not good enough to justify the prices.

I5537pxBLRHxDXZgDlkPQA.text: I've been going to Gianna Via's for years and love the place. The service and management has always been great and the pizza is my favorite. The bar area is a great place to watch a game and have a couple of drinks. They always have food and drink specials and there's a good clientele. They have a great back room for showers, birthday parties etc. that I've used a couple times. As far as the bad reviews I've read about the owner, I feel they are unfounded.  Sure he's trying to run a business which isn't always easy and sometimes comes off the wrong way but Gianna vias employees and provides income to a lot of people, many of whom are single mothers, college students, etc. Who have been there for years. My interaction with the owner and his wife have been excellent and they treat their employees like family. What you can't put in the words with a review of food or service is the support this place provides the local community. I know every New Year's eve they sacrifice a nights business and hold a private party that must cost them thousands to raise a significant amount of money for make a wish. I highly recommend the place.

iUBe0IXeqCi8jBqgzMMA3w.text: Great food at a reasonable price. I recommend the pizza and pasta specials but never had a bad meal. Looking for a quiet bar to meet friends this is your place. Great bartenders.

2QzsfYulsF3iy_IJWpW6ow.text: I have been going to this healthy alternative restaurant since it opened as the Italian Oven.  The breakfast is the best around with  great pancakes and waffles too.  Want blueberries on top?  They can do that.  The paninis are awesome with the Italian panini my favorite.  I haven't had a bad meal there yet and the recent addition of the bar makes for a great place to stop for a drink too.

lwjmpg_INKbPcyWJr5_NfQ.text: Disappointed as our "to go" order was wrong. After ordering and waiting at the bar for our order, one persons meal was completely excluded and one of the meals in our order was made without all the fixings. Although they refunded the amount of the missed meal, it was a big let down. First time there and we had been on the road all day looking forward to a good meal.

NBSTAr-_pXX6GQV9ezn83w.text: Since I hail from the Whitehall area, I went here for dinner the other night with my family.  We have been here several times and I usually split the portabella and wild mushroom pizza with my husband, which is always fairly tasty.  I guess he was feeling carnivorous and opted for the filet salad, so I order the grilled Tuscan Panini sandwich.  The dinners received a collective "meh" all around.  My sister had the salmon and she said we could make better at home.  I was surprised my sandwich came with Chicken since it was not listed anywhere in the description.  They also didn't have it on the Panini press long enough to even slightly melt the cheese, and it was cold throughout.  The homemade chips were pretty good though.  Next time I will just stick with the pizza (which is boosting this rating up to 3 stars).  They do have several dessert options which we couldn't resist and they were all thoroughly enjoyed.    I eat here when I'm visiting my family in Whitehall, but this is not a place I would go out of my way to patronize.  An upside is that it does provide another option in Caste Village to avoid the crowds at the madhouse that is Armstrong's.

uz-TPX6BPCEZFLbBLEV88A.text: Great little resturant! Pizza and buffalo chicken wraps are my favorite. The nachos are rely good too. A little on the expensive side for a the type of place that it is. Great service!

1LbqLraN9tvq-GxMg9-5GA.text: Great bar but very poor food quality. Been there several times and always disappointed.

KTJdtuGAVwbqBoy1gbrOzg.text: Loved the outside dining area. Beautiful day for some good Italian food!

d-wUWr1mX17jU3GAYI2hOg.text: Just had breakfast here for the first time. It was excellent. Breakfast panini was unusual and very tasty. Triple tined  forks make eating hash browns a challenge and help could be friendlier. Will go back again without hesitation

CWgzAnLnX9UPTYaHD3aABw.text: My friends and I met at Gianna Via's for dinner.  I ordered the Osso Bucco special, which was mediocre.  After spending $180 (inc. tip), one waitress abruptly came over to our table and told us "we are closed - you can use the side door".  We were given no warning.  We then proceeded to the bar for a drink.  Again, no "last call" warning - the lights suddenly came on.  While we were waiting for two friends to return from the restroom, two workers came over to us and told us to exit through the side door.  I certainly do not recommend this place as a gathering location, particularly if you plan on spending time chatting.   I felt like we were being pushed out the door.

xKLAm0rU9D9MEa0uAzXjqQ.text: We took my 90 year old aunt for lunch today and I'm glad her sight isn't what it used to be.  The restaurant was filthy at 12:15 -- not the end of the lunch crowd, nor was it crowded.  There was food on the floor, and at least one appetizer plate came out with food debris on it.  The fried zucchini was good, pizzas ok but very salty.  The service was only meh, and the waiter left dirty appetizer dishes on the table through the meal.

yZ8nLO4HT-3H1dgQRyR6kA.text: I must start my review with a disclaimer: I am a former employee of GiannaVia's. I started as a dishwasher and worked my way up to line cook. I don't know how things have changed since I left to take a full-time job in 2013, but I know my experience there was great, and I have been back many times since to keep in touch, and to eat the food of course!  I grew up in Whitehall Borough; it's a tiny, tiny little place with not much in the way of unique eateries. You have to travel to neighboring boroughs to find much worth your time. Armstrong's is in the same shopping center as GiannaVia's, and I was never a fan of it, so I was happy that with GiannaVia's renovation and addition of a bar, Armstrong's finally had some decent competition. GiannaVia's is a highlight in Whitehall because of its focus on quality ingredients and diverse menu.   GiannaVia's has a menu that has expanded much over the past few years, offering a range of Italian dishes, from the simple, rustic (and very popular) pasta d'angelo, to more 'luxurious' fare like pesto gnocchi and salmon with risotto and mixed vegetables. They also offer more standard food like personal pizzas, panini, fried appetizers of all kinds, and a great bunch of salads.   I know from firsthand experience that a large percentage of the dressings, sauces, and entree components are made from scratch, in-house. The ingredients are quality. The head chef there is a very passionate, driven young guy who takes food service and culinary creativity very seriously. I think he's a wonderful fit for the restaurant; he is always coming up with new ideas for specials, and does his best to maintain quality. Rest assured that if you have an issue with your food at GiannaVia's, it will be taken care of.   Even before I was an employee here, I would come in often with my family to get the soup of the day (usually one broth-based soup and another cream-based) with a panini. The panini are just the right size, with a toasty 'crunch' when you bite into the bread. The classic Italian panini was always my favorite - the perfect combo of capicola, salami, ham, and the like. I also love their pizzas, which are all baked to-order in a wood-fire oven. I'd recommend the buffalo chicken pizza if you like the conglomeration of salty, creamy (blue cheese!), smoky, and spicy. You honestly can't go wrong with a pizza here if you don't want to stray too far from 'normal.'   For some reason I think GiannaVia's salads stand out. They can get a bit pricy (I'm looking at you, salmon salad), but I love the combinations of ingredients. Try the beet salad, with roasted beets, pears, and goat cheese, or opt for my favorite, the heirloom tomato tower, a non-traditional "salad" that puts thick, juicy heirloom tomato slices in the spotlight, accompanied by fresh mozzarella, capers, and a balsamic glaze that I swear I could guzzle right out of the container.   GiannaVia's has a pleasant atmosphere, with lots of seating, a modest but beautiful bar that's out of the way of the regular dining room (without feeling like the bar and restaurant are separate entities), and an additional, spacious party room with some nice fixins' like a flat-screen TV and a fireplace. I have personally come back after my employment there for a party for my grandfather and can say that having a party catered at GV's is generally hassle-free. Servers are friendly and knowledgeable. Food comes out quickly, and I know from working in the kitchen that the flow of things is organized and quality-oriented.   The restaurant also has a breakfast menu, which is pretty good, though it's not the best breakfast in the 'Burgh. Expect to wait a while if you come for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Churchgoers from across the street seem to overflow right into the waiting area.   I can't say much else other than I really enjoy the food here. It can get a little expensive if you add appetizers, sides, and entrees together - it's very easy to spend $20 here - but I think it's well worth it for the portions and quality.

HtT9IKDmFesLJXo63jqvlQ.text: Excellent little cafe!  I stopped in this week to have breakfast with my grandmother.  I could not believe how good the prices were.  Most items were under $7.  We both had the Village breakfast which had potatoes, eggs, toast and a choice of meat.  The food was prepared quickly and was cooked very well.  They have HUGE coffee cups, which is always a plus!   The best part about my visit was our waitress.  Robin waited on us.  She was so positive, happy and attentive!  Her attitude and great survive made my day!  I can't wait to go back and try lunch or dinner!

unN3eSLtcwtt0lbEkSu0dQ.text: Visited for lunch recently with my mom as her friend recommended that we try it. I have to admit that my expectations were low going in because it seems I've become somewhat of a city snob, thinking that all the suburbs have to offer is chain restaurants and pizza. Shame on me because Gianna's is serving up some tasty classic Italian fare.  They served warm bread with a delicious balsamic dipping oil - seriously, I couldn't stop dipping even with my wedding less than 5 days away! We both ordered the wedding soup (2.50 extra with the lunch specials but included in most entrees). I thought the broth had great depth of flavor and I loved that fresh spinach was added just before serving so it retained the pretty green color and a little texture. I'd have liked more noodles, but I always have this complaint so never mind me.  For my lunch dish, I ordered the lunch portion of the Tuscan Florentine. Still a huge portion that would have been more than enough for a dinner but I cleaned my plate because it was so tasty. Angel hair pasta tossed with marinara and heavy cream, just the right amount of cream that the sauce was still light but decadent. The tangy bursts of sun dried tomato and the fresh spinach mixed throughout made for a very well rounded pasta dish. I think it'd be great with the grilled shrimp add-on for dinner.  They aren't reinventing the wheel, everything on the menu is familiar and sometimes that's what is so great about italian food. I'll definitely stop back to try some other items off the menu and check out their cocktail menu.

wlxw_6lsDaLRSrcXn7w9Aw.text: While the service was quite good, the food was not.  There were four of us. One was quite happy with his spaghetti and meatballs.  The order of linguine, turned out to be spaghetti. The third entree was Margarita Pizza, which was good, but has an overabundance of cheese. I had a prime rib panini, which was good, and a cup of lobster bisque.  Merriam Webster defines bisque as, "a thick cream soup made with shellfish or game." What we got was lobster broth.  No milk consistency. Very little lobster.  Was considering Gianna Via for catering, but won't be back.

piJzuP8s3uMfFv7K-YxBPQ.text: Ate there for their Sunday breakfast  over the 4th of July holiday.  Normally, food is really good.  Had a lot of company, so I took our party there.  Breakfast was absolutely terrible.  Eggs not cooked...one piece of ham in the omelet...toast cold.....waffle was just that...a waffle....cold.  Place was packed....but again, food was terrible.  Other people sitting next to us were terribly disappointed also.   We would have been much better off at Eat N Park.....much cheaper too.  Will never go back for their breakfast....and our waiter/manager kept telling us prior to us being served....best breakfast in town!!!!

U32GOMLN4ebEUBmOAIcgKQ.text: We visited this restaurant last night. We were greeted very prompt and was told there would be a wait. We only waited about 10 minutes which is good for a Saturday night. We sat in a booth in the bar area which was very nice. The server came took our drink order forgot my husbands beer twice. We had the spinach dip. Which was very bland it was served on what seemed to be a pre cooked pizza shell. The wedding soup was amazing. My husband ordered chicken Parm I had a margherita pizza. The chicken Parm was horrible. The server was very rude. When she asked after we were ready to leave how our food was I started to tell her and she blurted I'll take it off. Then stormed off. She did not check on us at all during our meal only to tell us that our food would be awhile. I believe her name was Tiffany. I will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gianna Via&#39;s chicken Parm.

8pZCO5i7xL2kbBEo12QZbQ.text: I went to Gianna Via two weeks ago with a friend.  We each had a pasta dish.  I had salad. My friend had soup.  The server was excellent --- friendly, attentive, etc.  The food was mediocre.

IrFYz0yEd6mG3wVfmMToIQ.text: First off, I've been here multiple times and my cousin is the head chef. So maybe I'm a bit biased. But I also love good food and can honestly tell you that you will get it here. Today I had the spinach artichoke dip for the first time which is served on bread, kinda like a small pizza. It is creamy without being overly cheesy and heavy. My boyfriend got veal Marsala which was cooked to perfection! The meat was tender and the sauce very flavorful. I got rigatoni with meat sauce that was good, not great. I should've gone with the lobster ravioli. I highly recommend stopping in. Chef Matt loves to experiment and come up with new exciting dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach and artichoke dip appetizer

wbmRwhQz2CcfhpF2YC9pUg.text: Decent service. Marginal food. Horrible atmosphere created by owners, a married couple, who squabble in public. Convenient location had been regular meeting place for friends. After owner's public berating of service staff and management, almost anywhere is a better place to meet and eat with friends. With so many restaurants in the area, will not return to Gianna Via's.

R_MetlttLZH6Qc8y7vMlgQ.text: Gianna Via's has become one of our favorite restaurants. We have visited at least 30 times over the past 3 years. They have a good kids menu, although usually my kids have the Italian wedding soup (they also like the kid's spaghetti and meatballs). The place is clean and usually we have had one of the same 3 servers. The outdoor seating is nice when the weather is good. They do half off appetizers outside and at the bar. They also have good gluten free choices including pizza. The prices are ok--perhaps a bit higher than some Italian places but not outrageous. I have never met the owner but was disappointed to read other reviews saying he was treating staff poorly. In my 30 or so visits to Gianna Vias, I have never witnessed that and in fact have seen the same staff most of the time, so the employee turn over seems to be low.

HutPuoOKP-PxMLnMXOWrhQ.text: This is my second time trying Gianna Via's through Uber and I will never be back. The first time I ordered through Uber they completely messed up my order and to make it right they mailed me a gift card. Although the giftcard was a nice gesture, I would have rather had a refund because I ordered a second time and couldn't use the giftcard on my meal. I paid out of my own pocket the 2nd time I ordered and asked for 2 ranches on the side for my fiances meatball hoagie because he CAN NOT eat it without ranch, they forgot the ranch So they messed up yet another meal from my order. My fiance called to explain the error and their manager picked up the phone and proceeded to tell him the sides of ranches weren't written in the order (as if he were lying). I looked at my Uber order and it showed I asked for the 2 ranches in the order, but we gave him the benefit of the doubt and thought maybe it wasn't visible on their end.  After my fiance hung up I looked at the receipts and it showed that in fact the 2 orders of ranch were on the order ticket that we received with out delivery. We called back and told him we found the receipt and he just said "sorry, we forget things sometimes." And hung up on my fiance. This restaurant obviously can't handle simple requests, the food was soggy and not worth the price and the manager was extremely rude!! Save your money and go to Pasta Too.

oNngIUkAqDU5zSFknDep2w.text: My husband and I enjoyed this restaurant for the first time tonight! I ordered the wedding soup and shrimp and lobster ravioli! I was nervous when I ordered the ravioli as I've never tried vodka sauce. When I received my dinner I was excited to try it as the presentation was appealing. One bite of the ravioli and I love love love love it!!! The prices aren't bad either!! It was 18 dollars for fresh rolls, wedding soup and my entree! My husband ordered there special with pork tenderloins wrapped in bacon and it looked delicious! He told me it was fantastic!!! We ordered an app of Italian nachos and they were excellent!!!!! I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys Italian food! All the food is home cooked!

UyHYSpnPkSdQcfS8Hiv6FQ.text: While I don't make it down to Gianna Via's as much as I'd like, it's one of my favorite places in Whitehall. The food is good and the bar is event better.  Food wise, I normally stick with the pizza. The dough and other ingredients are always extremely fresh and the sauce is delicious. The pizzas are cooked perfectly in a woodfired oven. Now, when I do pizza I do it right. The last one I had here was custom with mushrooms, italian peppers, red onion, meatballs, spinach, artichokes, banana peppers, and fresh basil.   Bar wise, I think they should use this as a tag line...."Dive bar prices in a high class space." Seriously, I can't drink at the corner bar or in the South Side for half the price of Gianna Via's. The bartenders are awesome, drinks are great, TVs easy to see, and the crowd is laid back. Appetizers are half off at the bar, they have a great beer selection, and their's always a great drink special on top of their already great prices. Last night it was $5 Long Islands with the lowest quality liquor being Bacardi...not bad! Thursday are also wine bottle night...they're all $17 (or something close to that).  If you're looking to entertain some friends, or watch a game, this is a great place to do it!

AvA_018bUhGtSJ5_cmgtyw.text: We were sat at a dirty table, and menus were filthy. My husband ordered a baked potato, server came out and said they didn't have baked potatoes. My husband then ordered wild rice, server came out and said they didn't have wild rice either. Server did not know the menu well. Our dinner rolls were frozen in the middle. There were flies and fruit flies flying around our food the entire time we ate. Chef was eating at the cooking station and kitchen staff swore loud enough for us to hear while dining. We will not be back.

qPiYx6Z3_ZkqY2gVbLVGyQ.text: Had appetizer and lunch there several times and they were great. Had dinner Tuesday evening, wife had Pasta D Angelo and I had Chicken Marsala, they both tasted like Birdseye frozen skillet dinners. Won't go back for dinner.

WjGHjTpiZiti_IBKqxZo1Q.text: Had lunch last week. Was great , the Potatoe bacon soup was 5 star. Waitress suggested come back for the Asparagus Soup! I will be back. The Chef creates some fabulous dishes. You must try this wonderful restaurant.

LQFblJ2WXq494_xzO62UYg.text: We chose a very busy night, so I didn't mind waiting to be seated. I ordered the wedding soup. It was 90% broth with a total of 2 meatballs. My chicken Parmesan was awful. The chicken was very dry. It is not breaded and lacked flavor. I got gnocchi with my meal. It tasted like the cheap gnocchi you buy in a bag at the grocery store. Very gummy & didn't taste good at all. I had heard good things about this restaurant, so I was very disappointed. We waited at least 20 minutes for a drink refill. My son's lemonade was thick like syrup & tasted awful. This has to be the worst Italian I have ever eaten. The owner (I'm guessing) walked past our table several times, but couldn't stop to refill our drinks or pick up the bill that we had to wait another 20 minutes for the waitress to get to. I do not blame the waitress at all, because they were seriously understaffed on a busy night. I would suggest having the greeters help the waitress when it is that busy. The greeter was sitting on the bench when we left, while every one of the waitresses were running around like crazy. I can cook better Italian food at home. $14 for chicken Parmesan isn't bad if it tastes decent, but this was the worst I have ever tasted. I was there with my two children ages 6 and 7 who heard one of the waitresses swearing very loudly at the front of the restaurant. We will not be back.

ah_Mz0JHm3VkkH_vqZHLYQ.text: Good food and friendly staff. Have to agree about the wedding soup, very good. Beer selection is very good. Try the Harry's Pizza.

Fb7kcUFbdHt-2SqyG0d2yw.text: Quick, no nonsense service. Lured there with a Groupon. No reservations, yet seated within 10 minutes on a busy night. Impressive menu. Decent wine list for a shopping center restaurant. Awesome, hand-tossed crust was delightfully chewy! Had the white pizza and a slice of tiramisu. Could use a water filter as the tap water had an aftertaste...so did the soda. We live in the area. Will be back!

Of3e9Im33Mi5IoFvZmKdiQ.text: Service wasn't very good. We wanted breakfast at 12:15pm according to the signs breakfast is served until 12:30pm. Waitress said she would ask, 15 minutes later the table next to use gets their breakfast waffles and server comes back and I ask, so can we order breakfast and she says sorry no?! So we ordered our food, I was last wanted a panini and she said oh we don't have those and point out the menu says they are only available from Monday to Thursday and after 10pm on a full moon if you get what I am saying. Oh well ordered something  else. My brothers girlfriend wanted  balsamic dressing for her salad and she comes back and says we don't have any made yet, but will later!!! Why can't you make it now I am thinking? All in all won't be going back ever

l4BV0qjL674FrwD3TeCwhQ.text: We've visited this restaurant on a few occasions. The food is okay, we always seemed to a bit disappointed and the consistency/freshness seems to vary. During our last visit, we witnessed an altercation between the owner and service staff. We were very disappointed with the way he spoke to her and spoke about a patron that defended her. There are so many other close great places owned by really nice people that we would rather support.

v3pruOfX-Qn7OF5C7csqyQ.text: I love going here! It's always busy but never overly crowded. The food is consistently good. I love the chicken Milano salad and the Italian nachos. My husband always gets a pasta or pizza and has been happy with his picks. The staff has always taken care of us. I have also been there for breakfast and wish they would bring back the lattes. That is my only complaint.

Godi6MumKWgcPpbtQwb7oQ.text: Literally had two drinks in 1.5 hours and was cut off. We even had food, I don't understand where it came from.... We were joking around with our server, if she can't handle the industry I'm not sure why she is working there. I am a bartender myself and am RAMP certified. These people really need some training, even the managers who threw the server under the bus when she came out to cut us off. Any respectable manager would have came out and had a normal conversation with us and would have realized there was absolutely nothing wrong with us.

8MYJBXIfILZOtBZzrWPdMA.text: The food here is really good and they have a variety of all different kinds of food. They do specialize in Italian but you can also get sandwiches, burgers and salads. I've never had a bad meal here. Their homemade Italian wedding soup is really delicious with fresh spinach leaves. You can even eat here if you are gluten free as they offer gluten-free crust for the pizza as well. If it's a Friday or Saturday night I would definitely recommend making a reservation as this is a popular stop for the Whitehall Baldwin area. They have a private room as well. I never went to a private party here but I know people who have and said the service was good. Our waitress last night was very friendly and provided great service.

pEk5GsSJ3nioZ0Ofh3xKug.text: This place is terribly unorganized. They screwed up our catering order after waiting 20 minutes to pay for it. They decided to wait on everyone with a smaller to go order first then got our order together then we still had to wait to pay. When we got home we noticed they forgot part of our order, I called and was placed on hold for several minutes then the manager got on and told me he forgot it because it was a single order ??? This guy is managing the place, what a joke. Very poor customer service. Not ready for a busy holiday.

_62b4exzukhnD6QKSWQbCA.text: When this place opened, it was the Italian Oven. So fantastic. Since it has become Gianna Via's the food, service and atmosphere has declined steadily. Last night, I endured the worst service I have ever experienced. It was busy. I was alone. I sat in the bar. The waitress started out okay, but quickly ignored me for customers she preferred (she spent lots of time with the couple in front of me). I did not get offered bread. I did not get offered a drink refill. My entree came before my salad. I did not get offered cheese (pasta).The salad had the wrong dressing. The entree had burnt spots on it. Without asking, the waitress assumed I was taking the salad home and dropped a take out container on the table without a word. I asked for a lid for the salad dressing and she came back much later and slapped it on herself. I waited at least 10 minutes for my check. The entire experience was awful. I did not make a stink. I did not tip well, but actually feel regret that I tipped at all. I may never go back.

R2fuGhMKKb3Xh5gto1kFUw.text: I have been to Gianna Via's several times, I think because I wanted to like it since I love Italian food! However, I unfortunately can honestly say that I am not impressed. Nothing was particularly bad or awful, but it was overall underwhelming.   The service and atmosphere was fine and the outdoor seating nice in good weather. I thought the food was mediocre and overpriced for the product. I specifically recall getting a penne a la vodka dish with chicken but it wasn't actual chicken breast. Instead it consisted of some sort of shredded chicken. The pizza was also bland and had too much crust around the outside.   I really don't recommend Gianna Via's. I would return if someone with me really wanted to go, but if you're in the mood for Italian, I think you can do better.

u6mCqIPHV5wJTfeEtiLL6w.text: I've had dinner here 1 other time with my mom and the food came out so fast we didn't even get a bite out of our salads so we had the server take it back by the time we got our food it was sitting under the heat lamp and totally dried out. Happen to be in the neighborhood last night so my husband and I stopped, I know you were very busy we both ordered the porterhouse mine was well done when I asked for medium, my husband came out perfectly that was so tough you couldn't eat it. The server did take off my meal which was very nice but I cannot convince my husband to come back. I understand about being busy but basically Server just threw the drinks down on the fly and took off. Slightly disappointed and not sure if I will return.

KPehVwz1-2bSIhcxmxqcpw.text: Nice bar atmosphere.  Dining room side feels more like a pizza place but maybe that's because it used to be the Italian Oven Restaurant.  They do have a pizza menu but have not tried yet.  Had homemade lobster & shrimp ravioli for dinner first visit.  Get 5 medium sized ravioli for a price of $18.  They were ok but nothing to write home about.  Next visit I ordered grilled portabella panini. (Pictured).  It is supposed to be made with roasted red pepper, aioli, provolone cheese and shredded romaine.  It was missing roasted red pepper and the rest of the ingredients are slim to none.  Had no flavor at all paid basically $9 for Ciabatta bread and an extra $1 for sweet potato fries.  The fries were very good.  Also the French onion soup was not bad but $7 for a bowl is a bit much.  When waitress asked how we liked everything we told her exactly what was not good.  She asked if she could get us something else that was an empty gesture because we were done eating then she just walked away.  Not impressed.  Maybe next time order through UBER-EATS delivery and try pizza at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French onion soup
Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pathetic Grilled Portabella Panini

WnzZHnJwfZ5P4ZQMIebkgA.text: Excellent Loved it! First visit was lunch today was breakfast! Gluten free for me and it was so good! My husband is a regular he and his coworkers eat here all the time. This will be our Sunday breakfast spot!

j88QQtrFm1NaeDKDdlv05Q.text: Food was ok but the service and atmosphere left a lot to be desired. We came about an hour to closing time on a weekday and were really annoyed by a loud, obnoxious group next to us. Server apologized and told us it was the owner and friends. She was busy running around for them and we didnt get refills. I left annoyed and underwhelmed. I wouldn't recommend this place.

o0eRyNG9U6ryhxp2NxEEyw.text: I'd give it a no star but Yelp hasn't made that an option.  Ordered the foot long fish sandwich to go.  Mushy fries I could have easily made myself with an old potato and no coleslaw.  $13 fish sandwich comes with coleslaw and I personally like it very much with fish.  Not there.  Called the restaurant...Rick said "uuuuuh ok next time you come in let us know".  Duh duh duh.  Never asked for my name.  Could care less who I am or what would make my order right.  These people don't care about you...find someone else who does.

ds6T-vxeMw8dFQex_bA9Dw.text: Best place to eat in caste village.. Huge portions friendly staff. Nice atmosphere bar apps half off at all times.

smniBjPoA5gP54Bp_4TSKQ.text: This place is minutes away from our house so we had to give it a try. It's a nice small little restaurant with a side bar area with some TVs to watch the games on. They surprisingly have a decent selection of beers on tap.  Service was good. They have daily specials on certain things. We went on a 2.50 domestic beer night. My husband and I shared a pizza. It was sooooo yummy. Very fresh with tons of flavor. It was huge! The place needs a little updating and more lighting.

eJ9fJWCLCr5k5Wohi66KeQ.text: Who knew that two of our favorites restaurants in Pittsburgh would end up in Caste Village?!   Our first time there tonight was a total treat. My husband had a Stromboli with mushrooms and spinach and thought it was outstanding. I had Pasta D'Angelo and a cafe salad. Both were delicious (we're always a fan of side salads that come with chick peas, and the balsamic was quite good). Even our 15 month old was enjoying it -- she ate more tonight than she has in months.   They were even quite accommodating when we realized my dish came without the chicken. Didn't matter. Was delicious without it.   Service is top notch. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive. Also very family friendly. Lots of families with young kids.

mStiooy6G-DVJCoXUk-OPQ.text: Very good food. Got pizza and toppings very fresh. Lasagna look very good, large portion, will try next time.

d_TMvaaspoGpV3jt0_62zg.text: I'm updating my review and giving Gianna Via's only 3 stars bc they are just ok, not A-OK.    This is a new restaurant and I truly believe the kitchen is just working the kinks out.   All the elements are there for Gianna Via's to be a very good restaurant, but they have not come together yet.  The food is good.  It's alright.  Nothing to complain about but I'd compare it's current quality to Eat 'n Park.  It's good.  You won't hate it.  My sister is a vegetarian and ordered the Tuscan panini.  As she's a vegetarian, she tends to look for items not including meat on the menu.  It was not a happy surprise when the Tuscan panini came out with chicken on it.  She's not a vegan, so she ate it anyway and said it was alright.  She ate only half of it, and we took the left overs home.  My father said he went to reheat the panini for lunch, and the half that my sister hadn't eaten had a hair in it.  My brother in law had the steak salad which he seemed to love.  My father had the pasta diavolo (diablo) which he enjoyed.  Both my brohter in law and fathers LERVE their food and are not picky eaters.  My sister and I are a bit more discerning.  I had the salmon, and for the price I felt it wasn't great.  I'm almost certain that it was reheated frozen salmon, not fresh.  It was still pretty good, cooked just right to where it flakes and is still rare in the center.  The service was...ok.  Having waited tables myself I take into consideration things like this being a NEW restaurant still finding its legs when I review the service.  Our waitress was clearly having an AWFUL day.  The kind of awful day where she was ALL OVER THE PLACE and very forgetful.    Our drinks came out right away, but we were starving and we had to track her down and beg her to bring us the bread they bring to the tables.  When she brought our bread, it was frozen in the middle.  I'm not going to get mad about FREE BREAD, so we just waited (a long time) and flagged her down for new bread.  When she brought our second loaf out she said, "I grabbed a loaf that's been sitting around for awhile so I'm sure it won't be frozen."  I guess they make frozen bread in the oven, but I still wouldn't tell a customer that their loaf had been sitting around for awhile.  The service was slow, we had to ask for our entrees and we had to ask for our checks.  I'm pretty sure this was our waitresses first time serving tables.  While the service was slow, she was really nice.  I say, give Gianna Via's a try, I really think that the food will continue to improve once this restaurant reaches its stride.   I'd also suggest vegetarians avoid ordering the Tuscan panini, or at least be sure to ask your server for confirmation your intended entree does not include meat.

1iHuWXfqXh0SjBqOY54-_Q.text: Good atmosphere, excellent pizza and Italian food. Accommodating to families. A fun afternoon or night without the giant chain feel

VbPrsKY5miOrjXFtLjvM6A.text: Thank you Gianna Via's !      Had a pickup catering order this evening and it was awesome !!  Assorted pastas, beautiful and delicious salad, chicken, and homemade rolls !  Lots of dressing and dipping sauce.  DELICIOUS! Very satisfied.

lKtHtC45npq_cSekGyGxRw.text: We ordered to go on a busy Friday night. They had it ready in 15mins. Hubby had a Stromboli with bacon, sausage, and ham. I had the Pasta D'Angelo with Lobster Bisque. We shared the Spinach and Artichoke dip. Everything was amazing with plenty leftover!

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pasta D&#39;Angelo highly recommended. The pine nuts add in awesome flavor. The dish is approved by me and my 11 month old!
Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stromboli with Bacon, Ham, and Sasuage. Large portion, plenty left over!
Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach and Artichoke Dip. Very creamy and flavorful. Highly recommended!

bS6yYcNAtTdqynVZ_bFtrw.text: I've read good and bad about this place. So I've been wanting to try it out. Monday was wing night and .50 per so I ordered a dozen. They were fabulous and quite large and I saved 6 for lunch. I ordered chix marsala and it was mediocre tasting but a nice portion. The wife ordered a roasted beet salad and nothing was roasted. It was can beets and thrown straight onto the plate after being cut up. She was very disappointed in her salad.  They give a nice basket of garlic rolls and my side salad was good.  The place is a bit dirty if you look at the walls under the table etc.  They have what seems to be some great bar specials of food and drink so I think we might try that side next time. Hopefully it's better over there.

y02qb2ZpGkJSooIjGPwGcA.text: The one star is for our server.  The best part of the meal. We should have known better!  Been going there for as long as they've been open, except for the last year. Stopped going after several bad meals (bloody wings and burnt potato skins at the same meal)! The management made good. Tonight, we ate what we could with bugs flying all over the place, then left without complaining. The owner who seems to know his regulars, but never bothered to come over to meet us in 9 years needs to  hire an exterminator. I know wine attracts fruit flies, but regular flies even in the bathroom. I'm still itching an hour after being home!

XFXW2V9XBNKnwI6lSjVYIA.text: DO YOU LIKE A GOOD WINE DINNER? well, we discovered that they have 1 every few months! the dinners are so good that frankly, i didn't write about the 1st 1 because i thought it was a fluke! so here are summaries of both! the 1st was on 4-3. it was their spring dinner. the 1st course was a belgian endive & radicchio with buttermilk bleu dressing & red wine fondue. it was paired with a rodney strong sauvignon blanc. both were perfect together. 2nd course-seared scallops with risotto & wild ramps, paired with rodney strong chardonnay. dee-lish-ous!!! i wanted more! 3rd course-horseradish & roasted garlic crusted beef tenderloin with duck fat potato galette & white onions, paired with rodney strong cabernet sauvignon. ok. where do i start? love, love, LOVED this entire course! the meat was done to a medium(i like rare, but I plowed forward!), the potatoes-mmmmmmm(I mean, made in duck fat! got me to go home & make 'em myself!) 4th course-paris-brest with mousseline cream paired with rodney strong pinot noir. what a way to end a meal!  the wine flowed throughout the evening. once we tried the whites, we were able to go back to just the reds. the staff was attentive. the people friendly. 6-26 was the summer dinner. WOW, just WOW! BRAVO!  1st course was a watermelon & feta salad paired with erath rose of pinot noir. refreshing, preparing you for what was to come. now i have to buy some feta! 2nd course was a pan seared duck breast with a port wine cherry sauce, paired with las mulas cabernet sauvignon. i love duck, so i was really excited for it, & i was not disappointed! i could've eaten a 2nd breast! 3rd course was KILLER!!! chef's bbq grill with smoked gouda polenta paired with born of fire cabernet sauvignon. the grill consisted of a portion of salmon, a lamb chop, a petite filet &......pork belly!!! that was THE BEST grill i have ever had! each piece of meat was done to perfection. pork belly!!! who knew that they knew that I love pork belly?! 4th course as 1 kick butt dessert! key lime coconut cake paired with murph chardonnay. real curls of coconut on top! they even had a little giveaway of some wines! tom & i have been to several wine dinners, & i can honestly say these folks know how to do it! the wines are all quite good, & there's always plenty to go around! the food has been outrageously wonderful! the staff works hard & does a great job keeping everyone, & everything, happy & running smoothly. PSST! the next 1 is 9-18. 7pm. be there to see how they will ever be able to top these past 2 dinners!

QpoY7oqGShzU6HWdITomhQ.text: The waitress was rude and ignorant, I asked if they served Pepsi or Coke products, she said Coke,and walked away. I didn't want Coke,I wanted iced tea instead but she walked away so fast that I couldn't tell her. Her attitude upon returning was hostile, so we left the establishment and went to Armstrong's in the same plaza.

mFozA7XsUNuvPgBxgKPsaA.text: Worst customer service I have ever experienced. Order a pizza and spinach dip at 615 pm last Friday. I arrived at 7:40 pm as I said I would be and my food still was not ready . The didn't seem to care the young very rude girl at the front said oh he forgot about it . Said it would be a few minutes . It was 8:05 pm and still was not ready. I went up asked for the manager and he didn't seem to care either or even know what was going on . I asked for a refund because I didn't want to wait . The ideas of ordering food was for convenience. I didn't feel Like cooking and had to be in bed early for work.... this was almost 2 hours and no food? Simple as a margarita pizza and spinach dip? I will never eat there or recommend this place . The sad part is that I am a member of ILKB ( I love kickboxing) and they were a partner business for a 10% discount . No I r had any clue and the girl at the front made a big deal about 10% and she threw my credit card on the counter . Not sure if their food is good but the customer service is horrible right down to the manager .

6_GzkvfI03OZ1k0wIl7sLg.text: Excellent breakfast burritos! Great service good coffee  Very clean and nicely decorated for Christmas!  Extensive menu something for everyone

80FiwsZi5iqrkq7NAJnfmQ.text: This is my wife and my favorite place for breakfast. Although we've enjoyed lunch & dinner there...we LOVE their breakfasts. They have everything, from the very simple, eggs, toast & coffee to the more complex, make your own omelette. And everything is reasonably priced! Their coffee is hot, flavorful and comes in a good sized mug. The staff is friendly and they work well together as a team. We usually get their Village breakfast which includes 3 eggs any way, red skinned potatoes and one can choose from a wide selection of meats and toast. My 'go to' is potatoes, eggs over easy, sweet sausage paddy (delicious) and rye toast. For my wife it's scrambled eggs (very fluffy), potatoes, crispy bacon & no toast. Fresh and oh so good. We've also had the pancakes, waffle, western and meat lovers omelette.. I am sorry to read the less than stellar reviews. I get it, no place is perfect. But I can say that we've NEVER had bad service or a bad meal there!!!!

EQdKiApC2VuReFkjCBHucw.text: When you have to bus your own table & ask for more water then that's a place I don't want to eat at anymore. Terrible customer service at times, but especially last week. The male server never said hello to us, when the food came out they never took away our finished plates, which I thought was strange. We never had our water glasses filled, was never asked how our meals were (they were good). The outside shades were down to block the sun, but another server (young kid, not Jimmy), pulled them back up & said they have to be at this height. Ummmm, aren't I a paying customer?? Why can't the shade be down for us to block the sun?? Just so incredibly frustrating. I've had this server before. He is not friendly. Seems overwhelmed, perhaps? I enjoy the food & atmosphere, but often times the staff is rude. Please work on your customer service & that one star will turn into five!!!

pHTJl0mSD5FkCa7NeKw8uw.text: OMG, the best lasagna around. This place aims to please. I go there weekly and even have my monthly mastermind here. The staff is so great and the owner is too. I have tried many things here and have not been disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. OMG, this lasagna is delicious and SO BIG! Loved it.

sciyiej2bgQZFqZbiNuf5A.text: My group of four was cut off from alcohol after being there for maybe two hours and having a few drinks.  The fact that we were cut off was absurd, as there were older people outside and at the bar who were much louder than we were.  The way we were told we were cut off was also extremely unprofessional and consisted of the managers throwing their server under the bus.    Will definitely not be going back.  Poorly ran establishment with below average food.  Avoid this place and walk up the sidewalk to a quality restaurant like Armstrongs instead.

ImK7a-ZehVBVbKo4BjUnZQ.text: This is a place that was recommended to me by a family member. I came with the same person who recommended. Upon entering, I almost sat in spaghetti sauce on seat, but thankfully I noticed before I sat down. Had to find someone to clean the seat. I had previously checked out the menu online and had an idea of what I wanted, but when I got my.menu, it was a bit different and the items I wanted weren't on it. Yet, they were on the other persons menu. So we asked the server which was correct and she had no idea. She had to ask 2 managers. Our server was extremely scatterbrained, which was confusing because there were only 3 tables occupied and they weren't even hers. She didn't know the soup of the day, the specials, etc. Had to ask for items like a serving spoon and a take out container, then a bag, multiple times each. It was getting old. I ordered a side salad and stuffed banana peppers. Both were really good. Other person ordered wedding soup and stuffed zucchini, also both very good. All in all, the food was excellent but the service left a LOT to be desired.

pEaJc0lGu8wrsgsNcp6uow.text: Came here for lunch on a Sunday and are very glad we did. I'm surprised at the bad ratings because we were very pleased: very friendly service, food came out in reasonable time, portions were huge, food delicious! Two things stood out for us: the child menu was inexpensive and the portion huge (our 3 year old grand made three meals out of it!) and the selection of beers and craft beers was amazing! We're from Colorado so not easily impressed by beer selections elsewhere. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that we asked about calamari (our Italian restaurant staple) and were told they discontinued it even though it was a best seller. Next time we're in the Mt Lebanon area, we will definitely go back here!

M876xBa-sOXGKe_N2HqHFg.text: My husband and I have had dinner several times at Gianna Via's. The food is mediocre at best but since this is a local establishment, we continued to patronize it.  The last time we were there, we had an early dinner and sat at the bar.  The owner was sitting at the end of the bar with his buddies and was speaking loudly about the bartender and calling her the "C" word.  I was the only other female in the bar location and he could have cared less if he was offensive. He is the most obnoxious, arrogant and inappropriate business owner I have ever experienced in my life.  The staff are fantastic and should really give consideration to leaving this restaurant and find a boss who treats them and their customers with some respect!  I have read several reviews on this site and I will also be sure to let everyone know of my experience at this establishment and would never recommend anyone spend any of their hard earned money only to be  put in this ignorant bastard's pocket!  I am giving 1 star because the staff is great, otherwise I would give no stars!

4ntiZ12_HbaJZGGZKbKegQ.text: Have you ever eaten chicken that's been frozen for too long?? That has a funky taste? This nothing about their meal tasted fresh. It was honestly gross.  I love to support a family owned business but unfortunately they're doing it wrong. Better off at Olive Garden.

zlugE1Z_EQ_6klKkFDHaHQ.text: I go there for pizza or their lemon ricotta pancakes with blueberry syrup. It's either one or the other but nothing else, except the last time I was there we sat in the bar area and had hotdogs and fries and they were very good. The staff is very attentive and friendly. The crowd is a mix of South Hills retirees and families.

xzP8lANjQjHHMcv2jHoVZw.text: This is one of my go-to restaurants. I have never had a bad experience here and highly recommend it to anyone who asks!  The food has a great American twist on traditional Italian cuisine. Some of the items can tend to be a little pricey, but you can usually find deals on the app Local Flavor. My personal favorite dish is their crab cakes or chicken parmesan!   The staff is always attentive and prompt as well!

HFBrUg08qnLP7qGY4VjNhA.text: I've given this place multiple chances and I just have to be honest, their food is not that great and they are way overpriced for the sub par food quality. One time I ordered biscuits and gravy for brunch, and the biscuits were so hard it was like cutting into a rock. My eggs were like chewing on sponges...Yesterday, I just spent $30 on two burgers for pick up, and I could've went to Burger King and been way more satisfied for a fraction of the price. Their menu descriptions made it sound gourmet, but I'm almost certain the patties are frozen and the size could've passed for sliders. Total disappointment. The bar is nice though. They just price themselves way above what they are worth.

Yp7OgkqbZgqpF6BBuAio-w.text: Great place for some quality flavored food! Stopped in for breakfast and had the big breakfast, French toast was amazing! Our server was great and gave us all recommendations that we fell in love with. Will definitely come back when I'm in Pittsburgh.

UTFqJ5V9UHoK6BzjFgWn3A.text: The drinks are good. Food is ok. The food isn't what will keep up from going back though- what will is the service and management. So unbelievably rude. I honestly don't think the management even cares they work in a hospitality business. The server took 10-20 minutes to bring a drink each time without apology. Mind you the place wasn't busy. Stinks this is one of the only restaurants near my house because I won't be going back.

vGbYmT7Eg-66v5tLmOlgdQ.text: Service and management were great but food is terrible. First time we went both meals were cold and the steak salad had about a 2oz portion. Management comp'd us so we decided to give another try with simpler dishes of pizza and chicken parm. Pizza was burnt badly and chicken parm isn't breaded?? I'd also be willing to bet their pizza and pasta sauce are the same.   From other reviews it looks like lunch is a safer bet here, maybe better cook staff?

FvbL3nZPRQ9A0GbP9YyRcw.text: Wow, what an unexpected surprise! Gianna Via's isn't in an area that I usually frequent for dinner, but it's a place that I've drove by several times and decided to give it a shot. And I'm very glad that I did!   The service was so, so. But the staff was very kind and friendly so it made up for it. The menu was extensive, items ranging from steak and crab cakes to sandwiches and chicken wings. We decided to order the grilled salmon, which was served with risotto and fresh veggies & the lobster ravioli which was to die for! Not to mention the appetizer (Ruben flatbread) which was out of this world good.   Not only was the food delicious, but our drinks were as well! We both tried one of the $7 martinis (Wednesday night special) and they were both top notch!   Saying this place was a great experience is an understatement. The food quality was untouchable, and the drinks were very unique. To top it off, the prices were very reasonable which is a rarity these days.   Outside patio seating, not the prettiest view (parking lot) but a very nice option on warmer days! There are dogs allowed outside on the patio as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster &amp; Shrimp Ravioli (homemade, and delicious)
Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side salad (comes with entrees)
Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled salmon (veggies and risotto were amazing as well)

hGm8RsQiGyBYI707bssrgw.text: What a great find. We were tired after a stressful evening-just wanted to relax. We found just that place! We each order a pasta dish. I had the ravioli and the homemade pasta and sauce we exceptional. They make their own dressings for the salads and they were very good too. We also had the fried zucchini as an appetizer-yum! The best part of our experience was the waiter. He was funny, informative, and really helped us make our choices. Will definitely go back when we are in the area again.

oNug7jfIugFmoeyywnl_ug.text: I give this place a four star rating. It is simple good Italian food. You will get a very generous portion. I had hot stuffing peppers. The peppers were Hungarian hits and the sausage was also hot. The wedding soup is great    The salad is fresh and well presented.

photos.caption: Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster &amp; shrimp ravioli.

2ylp8kaXKWHE1ZXCisEF3A.text: I went to Gianna Via's for baby shower a few weeks ago. It was my first time there - the shower was from 1pm - 4pm on Sunday afternoon.   They have a great breakfast/brunch because the restaurant was packed when I got there. For the baby shower, we had brunch as our meal.   There was French toast, bacon, scrambled eggs, fruit salad, sausage, and so much more. The food was very good. I would definitely go back to try something off the menu.   Unfortunately, the only downfall was that the space they had for the baby shower guests was just a little too small. It was little too cramped for a bigger party.   However, if I'm in the South Hills - I would definitely stop in again. When I was leaving, lots of a customers were ordering the pizzas and they smelled to die for!

JQzX3DOMtZUWHWejBpP9CQ.text: Love the pizza at this restaurant....Great atmosphere....Prices seem a little steep, but the portions are great.  3 starts because the wait time for my food every time I go there seems to get longer and longer!

qNC_9SoRaZUqo3hCjgj0Iw.text: Gianna Via is your neighborhood Italian Restaurant that also happens to have a GREAT bar. It has become one of my and my husband's favorite restaurants in our neighborhood. When we come here, we only sit at the bar because you really can't beat the specials. The drink specials are great, but even better are the half off (select) appetizers. FYI, this special also applies to their outdoor seating, but not in the dining room. A few appetizers that we've tried that we really enjoyed are the bruschetta and spinach and artichoke dip. I love tomatoes, so the large chunks of tomato on their bruschetta makes it my favorite appetizer. One of these days we will try their pasta and entrees, but it's hard for us to decide on anything other than their pizza. My husband will tell you that Gianna Via has his favorite restaurant pizza. Their pizzas are consistently good, with a crispy outer crust and very fresh toppings.   Gianna Via is definitely our go-to when we're looking to hang out locally in a casual setting, sip on drinks and enjoy eating some carbs.

0vdpESxqb_SlMT0ihGbnHg.text: As I said in my last review I was going to have a pizza on my next visit.  I built my own with pepperoni and some peppers.   I liked the crust and the pizza was good.   The bar seems to be popular.  The restaurant was crowded with families.   Our server was friendly and pretty good but seemed to be rushing and kept handing plates across a round table that would have been easier to walk around and serve.

olbe5zOy23UkLWIG8-G7jg.text: I had my bridal brunch shower here and I can't say enough how kind and accommodating the staff was! The staff is super friendly and the food was yummy! Still smiling from the event!

CQDRla5MzheTabu0XRfXpA.text: First time eating here last night for sons birthday. All of the food was great but the staff was even better. Made something special for my picky son that wasn't on menu. Just a great little family restaurant

RkXAtR8XyrtgNgHHWoECjQ.text: [Star-rating is tentative.]  Visiting tonight for the first time, with my wife and (2) other couples...  I am apprehensive.  I wish I had read the YELP reviews earlier.

hoyMXsMugHqhFLZC8PGVbw.text: Gianna Via's has great food, the chef came out as we were eating dinner and was very kind to us and even brought out a little birthday cake on my uncle's birthday. The only reason I won't give five stars is because there was a waitress during one of our visits who had a bit of an attitude with us, she seemed impatient as we ordered. Maybe she was having a bad day but that was still no excuse to be unprofessional. Besides that, the portions and price are reasonable and the food and staff are generally great!

U92HTis2HPe4yRhlkR0ABw.text: This was one of the top three worst pizzas I've ever ate. The dinners looked fabulous, but the pizza was literally like thin cardboard, loaded with sauce and very little cheese. Flavorless. I should mention that we ordered their traditional pizza with 1/2 pepperoni. thank God for that half, bc it actually gave the pizza some flavor.   The only reason I am giving it two stars, instead on one,  is because the presentation of the food, including a side salad I ordered and the fact that other dinners I saw coming out of the kitchen looked appetizing.

CtfVxIreVfxe2tuJFld5kg.text: Thank you so much for seating our party of 8 last minute after Armstrong's made us wait for a table in an empty restaurant for over 30 minutes.  Food was great, prices good and service was awesome!!!! Armstrong's host told us as we were leaving that we'd pay more- sooooo not True.

XQrvc8iH2BY82Q69VHd1Gw.text: It is okay. Nice selection on tap, gluten free pasta and pizza options, and the heirloom tomato bruschetta is a treat.  However, the menu is more pizza and sandwich with a handful of entrees. While their beans-and-greens starter is usually very good, the cod over beans-and-greens entree does not work.  The pizza is good...but many of the pasta combinations are disappointing.  While I will dine here on occasion, it is not my choice for anything other than a quick casual meal.

0z1nmVHaoIyZWC0Ihj5MnQ.text: One star is too good for this place.  I don't typically leave reviews for resteraunts.  I get that stuff happens and sometimes orders get messed up.  Usually, at an actual resteraunt, when this happens, they'll fix it.  This Sunoco hotdog version of an Italian restaurant refused to do so, after we ordered a large plain pizza, some pasta, 3 sliders, an IBC rootbear, and some appetizers. We recieved a large pepperoni pizza, a burned Patty in-between two buns with nothing on it, no rootbear, and cold appetizers.  Not cool, man.  4 of our 6 items were wrong.  When we called, they responded with 'what do you want me to do about it?' and told us we were out of luck.  That's some garbage if you ask me.  Thankfully, GrubHub will refund us and we can order a replacement from an actual place of business.  Would not order again.  Thanks!

MCu2Px2kNsFXsLGqZW9q6g.text: Terrible terrible terrible my family went on a Friday night it was a little busy I ordered the cod with greens and beans it was like soup disappointing. The ceaser salad was bad iceberg lettuce? No dressing the service was horrible!! After watching our waiter stand against the wall looking out the window finally came over and ASR's if we wanted our check ?? Really he never once came back to the table after someone else brought the food I then told him how unhappy I was with my dinner.  His answer???! Oh well that's from the microwave we will never never go back there

WfGfXVhl3WirGOI6BTJ4tg.text: Dined here for the first time this evening. Overall, the service was great but we were a bit disappointed in the portion size and quality of the meals. I ordered the salmon salad and subbed shrimp- only 4 shrimp were included and many other toppings listed on the menu for this option were omitted. My boyfriend had the chicken with vodka sauce and was very disappointed in the size of the meal but did enjoy the taste. We likely won't return but it was overall a 3 star experience

-NEXYOlQu-CnpoENePhbjg.text: We tried this for dinner for the first time tonight. We have lived in Castle Shannon our entire lives, but have never visited, so we decided to give it a try. Staff was very friendly. I ordered the Ravioli Olivia with soup. I had the lobster bisque soup. I thought the soup was excellent. The ravioli was extremely thin and barely filled. The sauce also had a slight spice to it and tasted a bit off/odd to me. Sadly it was not appetizing. My boyfriend had the crab cakes. He said he enjoyed the crab cakes but the risotto and vegetables were not great. He said the vegetables were cold and the risotto had "unique" flavors. We ended the night with chocolate cake. The cake was very good and they have a nice variety of desserts. It was nice that they accept enjoy book coupons which we were able to use, but unfortunately I am not sure if we will be returning since we weren't crazy about the taste of our main entrees.

Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Gianna Via’s Restaurant & Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L9_BL5_4kdoNBhf35YlsOA.text: One of my favorite local restaurants!! Service is always efficient and friendly, food always fresh. I love the margarita pizza!! The crust is to die for, it's a cornmeal type crust that's amazing!! Their turkey burger and sweet potato fries are also great if you're not in the mood for Italian. The wedding soup is a great started, and the pasta deangelo is an old favorite of mine! Definitely recommend

TEx_tCPD8MKJJ44zcA6hGQ.text: Was visiting Pittsburgh for my bridal shower (my whole family lives here), and this was the place we all came to eat at. We were in a separate room that had two long tables inside - we sat at only one of the tables. After sitting, the servers (I believe there were two), greeted us and grabbed drink orders. Overall, the service was decent - no complaints here. My concerns are the food itself. Appetizers were bruschetta and fried zucchini. The brushetta had nice flavor, but the tomatoes were stacked wayyy too high (for my liking). The zucchini was not very good. It seemed like it was under fried and sat in the window for a while because it was really soggy. My entree was the chicken marsala. The noodles were cooked perfectly, and the sauce was slightly under flavored but the chicken... The chicken was very dry and charred badly. I did not even finish half of my meal (which I actually shared with someone - so a fourth).  I visit Pittsburgh a lot (it is my hometown), and I have never been here before, but I probably not return.

RAVY28HR5WBkpilJRKwfBQ.text: What a great find!  We tried this restaurant at the advice of a relative, and we were thrilled.  The place doesn't look like much from the outside, and the inside decor isn't anything to write home about either, but the food is fantastic!  I loved the variety of items on the menu, including gluten free pizza crust, and the cocktails were great as well. As someone who is gluten sensitive, I LOVE being able to have brick oven gluten free pizza!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  And best of all, the prices are super reasonable.  Even the service was perfect.  Our server was one of the most attentive servers we have had in a restaurant in a very long time.  Her service was better than we have had in some 4-star establishments.  I can't say enough good about this restaurant, except that we will definitely come here whenever we come to Pittsburgh.

qUzaQMjUrXW1n-9sh-fSfA.text: Never going back.  I visited this place to check out the new bar they put in.  We had an awesome bartender Susanne, and we had some killer cocktails.  However, the owner of the place was sitting down at the end of the bar, drinking(most likely drunk).  He was chastising his employees in front of his friends, like he was on a power trip.  This put the bartender in tears, and another waitress in tears.  Shortly thereafter, a patron of the bar left, yelling at the owner for treating his employees like crap.  Once he left, the owner and his "buddies" sat there loudly making fun of the customer for walking out. Stating "I don't care if he ever comes back".   Not only did this make us uncomfortable, it is beyond unprofessional. I will never return to this establishment, and I am happy to share this story with anyone who wants to listen.  Shame on him, and the piss poor management tactics.  There are 100 different ways this should have been dealt with.  The End.

KQimrYYZ1QSmTsSn8R2Qrg.text: I went to GV's for a family dinner on a recent Sunday night. The 9 of us made reservations and arrived at 6:30. We were taken to a back room for more space. The restaurant became quite busy by the time we left. For dinner, I ordered a cup of wedding soup and the penne vodka with chicken. The dish was described as spicy so I was intrigued. The wedding soup was fairly standard. I did enjoy the fact that the spinach was fresh and added on top the soup. However, I was missing more veggies and cheese. My chicken penne vodka was also nothing to write home about. There was a very small amount of chicken and the dish was far from spicy. In fact, it seemed much more creamy than most vodka sauces. I tasted my husband's special- pot roast with mashed pots and brussel sprouts. The pot roast was flavorful but the brussel sprouts were almost inedible. I love me some brussel sprouts. When done correctly, they can be salty, crispy and savory. These brussel sprouts were mushy and bland.  Overall, the food was average for this type of restaurant. I doubt I will return to GV's because there are many other family style restaurants around with more flavorful selections.

whEbYGsh2-9i6xPwJRH23g.text: Very attentive wait staff, excellent wedding soup and cafe salads.  The bread was warm, fresh, fluffy and was awesome with olive oil!  My raviolis were clearly made in house and the sauce really had a strong fresh tomato flavor.  My husband had the chicken Alfredo, and he only wished the chicken had been grilled.  He ate it all though and really liked the sauce.  We will be back!
